document.title: Structural and Magnetic Investigations of Cs<sub>2</sub>AgF<sub>4</sub> and Its Doped Derivatives
document.abstract: This thesis describes the structural and magnetic properties of solid state silver fluorides such as Cs2AgF4 and its doped derivatives. A wide range of techniques such as X-ray and neutron diffraction, susceptibility measurements and inelastic neutron scattering experiments are used to characterize these materials. Silver fluorides are important given their strongly correlated magnetic behavior and the potential to discover a new class of high TC materials. Few studies have been done on silver (II) fluorides as their characterization has been problematic due to their inherent air and water sensitivity. This study is the first to accurately characterize two of these materials.
